category.name: Aptitude
category.description: Develop mathematical reasoning and problem-solving skills for competitive exams and interviews.

sub_categories.name: Trigonometry
sub_categories.description: Master trigonometric functions, identities, and applications.

exercises.title: Complex Trigonometric Analysis
exercises.description: Master complex trigonometric analysis and advanced applications.

tasks.title: Fourier Transform
tasks.question:
What is the Fourier Transform used for?

Consider: Signal processing and frequency analysis
tasks.hint: Think about converting between time and frequency domains
options: Converting signals between time and frequency domains

tasks.title: Complex Trigonometric Functions
tasks.question:
What is Euler's formula?

Consider: Relationship between exponential and trigonometric functions
options: e^(iθ) = cos(θ) + i sin(θ) - Euler's formula

tasks.title: Spherical Trigonometry
tasks.question:
What is spherical trigonometry used for?

Consider: Applications on curved surfaces
options: Solving triangles on curved surfaces like Earth

exercises.title: Advanced Trigonometric Applications
exercises.description: Apply advanced trigonometric concepts to complex problems.

tasks.title: Signal Processing
tasks.question:
What is the Nyquist frequency?

Consider: Sampling theory and signal processing
tasks.hint: Think about the minimum sampling rate
options: The highest frequency in a signal
Half the sampling rate - minimum required
The lowest frequency in a signal

tasks.title: Harmonic Analysis
tasks.question:
What is a harmonic in signal analysis?

Consider: Frequency components of a signal
tasks.hint: Think about integer multiples of a fundamental frequency
options: An integer multiple of the fundamental frequency

tasks.title: Phase and Amplitude
tasks.question:
What is the relationship between phase and amplitude in trigonometric functions?

Consider: How phase affects the function
tasks.hint: Think about horizontal and vertical shifts
options: Phase affects horizontal position, amplitude affects height
